result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st) (PAC<0.15)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ivan Rojas Flores

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 17, 2022 at 10:20 am.

No contact with victim(s): D.T.R.; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk Micki. 
Case Called: 2:30 p.m.

State appears by ADA Rory McGarry for ADA Kerri Puig.  Defendant appears in person, pro se.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY. 

COURT ORDERS: $1,000.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): D.T.R.
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
- No driving without valid DL. 
- Prints and photographs. 

Dates:
PTC 11/17/22 at 10:20 a.m.

Branch 3.

ADJ: 2:34 p.m.
Re: Copy of Summons and Criminal Complaint mailed to defendant
